intro: Oxygonum dentatum, commonly known as the toothed spurge, is a herbaceous plant native to tropical and subtropical regions. It features succulent, fleshy stems and leaves with serrated edges, which are characteristic of the Euphorbiaceae family. The plant produces small, yellowish flowers in clusters, typically blooming in the summer months. It is often found in disturbed soils and can thrive in a variety of light conditions. Oxygonum dentatum is also known for its milky sap, which can be irritating to the skin.
